comment: Dr. Miles is a considerate person and her class is enjoyable. If you enjoy reading then take this class. Do not slack on the assigned readings and take lecture notes. The textbook is used throughout the entire semester. There are weekly 350 word discussion post, which can be exhausting. Two 5-7 page essays, go to the writing center!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: This class is challenging if you aren't great with literature. Dr. Miles gives lots of reading for homework, but a lot of it's interesting. You're expected to discuss it in the next class. The weekly discussion posts are long and irritating at times. But she's understanding and grants extensions. If you put in the effort, it'll show in your grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: Professor Miles is a wonderful professor and human being. She truly cares about the students and recognizes that we're all human, so she's willing to work with you. Show that you care and do the readings and there's no reason you can't get an A :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Dr. Miles is amazing, super sweet and caring and definitely willing to help you if you need it. Two mid-length essays and weekly discussion posts, but mostly she really wants you to participate in the class discussion. Only difficult thing was her essay topics are really vague but she expects a specific thesis, but you can run it by her beforehand

She is a great English professor. I took her for one of my honors courses and she is very understanding and tries her best to work with all students. There are few grades, which include a midterm, final, two papers, and weekly discussion posts. As long as you come to class and read the assigned readings then you will do fine in this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: I absolutely HATED her class. It almost put me to sleep every single day. What she expects from her students on a weekly basis is quite ridiculous. There are so many readings on top of discussion posts and literary analysis. Good luck if you take it. Dont recommend it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This class is specifically for PEGS students but if you ever have the chance to take Michelle Miles she is a wonderful professor!

Dr. Miles is by far the best professor I've ever had. She's kind, knowledgeable about her subject, and easy to talk to. She can be scatterbrained sometimes but it just adds to her charm. She's so open & encouraging of alternate readings of the texts, though there is a load of reading, but it's manageable. I adore her & wish I could take her again!
